entities.name: ANCIENT EGYPT
entities.description: Ancient Egypt is the civilization known for its elaborate burial practices and beliefs about the afterlife

entities.name: PYRAMIDS AT GIZA
entities.description: The pyramids at Giza are monumental structures built to house the pharaohs and other important individuals in the afterlife

entities.name: PHARAOHS
entities.description: Pharaohs were the rulers of ancient Egypt and were often buried in elaborate tombs such as the pyramids

entities.name: BOOK OF THE DEAD
entities.description: The Book of the Dead is a collection of spells and prayers intended to help the deceased navigate the dangers of the afterlife and reach the realm of the gods

entities.name: EMBALMERS
entities.description: Embalmers were skilled individuals responsible for the mummification process, which involved preserving the body to prevent decay

entities.name: PRIESTS
entities.description: Priests were religious leaders who played a crucial role in the burial process, performing rituals and guiding the deceased on their journey to the afterlife

entities.name: PROFESSIONAL MOURNERS
entities.description: Professional mourners were hired by the deceased's family to lead the funeral procession and perform rituals to honor the deceased

entities.name: MUMMIFICATION
entities.description: Mummification was the process of preserving the body to prevent decay and ensure its preservation for the afterlife

entities.name: BURIAL
entities.description: Burial in ancient Egypt was a complex and carefully orchestrated affair that included the construction of tombs, mummification, and the inclusion of religious texts and amulets

entities.name: DECEASED
entities.description: The deceased in ancient Egypt were individuals who had died and were prepared for the afterlife through elaborate burial practices

entities.name: TOMBS
entities.description: Tombs were structures built to house the deceased and their possessions, ensuring their safe passage into the afterlife

entities.name: AMULETS
entities.description: Amulets were small objects with magical properties, often included in the burial chamber to protect and guide the deceased in the afterlife

entities.name: LINEN BANDAGES
entities.description: Linen bandages were used in the mummification process to wrap the preserved body, ensuring its protection and preservation

entities.name: SALT
entities.description: Salt was used in the mummification process to dry out the body and prevent decay

entities.name: PAPYRUS SCROLLS
entities.description: Papyrus scrolls were used to inscribe the Book of the Dead and other religious texts, which were placed in the tomb with the deceased

entities.name: FUNERAL PROCESSION
entities.description: The funeral procession was a ritual in which the deceased was carried to the burial site, often led by professional mourners and priests

entities.name: INTERNAL ORGANS
entities.description: Internal organs were removed during the mummification process to prevent decay and ensure the body's preservation
